name: Drip, Drip, Drop, Little April Showers Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: April is a full-fledged ninja and a member of the Foot Clan in the 2012 animated series.
questions.explanation:
False.

	April, after more than two years of training, graduated as a full kunoichi. In doing so she became a member of the Hamato Clan, as she was trained by Hamato Yoshi (Splinter). The Foot Clan was one of the evil groups she and the turtles fought against.

questions.text: For most of the 2012 series, April wore a yellow shirt with what number printed on it?
questions.explanation:
5.

	The number was 5, and while it was never fully explained, fans estimated it was because she was the "fifth" member of the turtles. She had brownish red hair that was shoulder length. She wore a black shirt with the yellow shirt over it and black leggings with jean shorts.

questions.text: Which Turtle was April shown to have the closest relationship with in the 2012 animated series?
questions.explanation:
Donatello.

	Donnie was shown to have a romantic crush on her. She never reciprocated those feelings, but was shown to spend much more time with him than any of the other turtles. She had inside jokes and a shared scientific interest with him.

questions.text: In the 2012 animated series, April was born a half human and half Kraang mutant, giving her what type of powers?
questions.explanation:
Telepathy.

	Her extra mental abilities included the power to be able to move objects with her mind, see into someone's soul, sense their true feelings and mentally communicate with others. She used the powers as part of her fighting abilities. Telekinesis was especially helpful in allowing her to fight from a distance by moving her weapons with her mind.

questions.text: Who had kidnapped April in the 2012 series premiere, causing her to need rescuing by the turtles?
questions.explanation:
The Kraang.

	April and her father were both kidnapped by the Kraang in the 2012 series premiere episode. The turtles broke into the lab and rescued her, but were unable to save her father, who ended up getting mutated as a result.  Eventually April befriended the turtles and became an ally in the fight against evil.

questions.text: What job did April have in the early episodes of the 2003 animated series?
questions.explanation:
Lab assistant.

	In the 2003 animated series she was depicted as being in her early 20s. Much like the original comic book series, she was Baxter Stockman's lab assistant. It wasn't until the 1988 cartoon that she was first depicted as a news reporter.

questions.text: Which character was April shown to have married and had children with in the 2003 animated series?
questions.explanation:
Casey Jones.

	The two of them were shown to have an attraction in many episodes early in the 2003 series. In the "Fast Forward" season they were shown to have been married and had children. When the show went back to the main timeline, their wedding was eventually shown.

questions.text: In the 2003 animated series, April was a co-founder of the company O'Neil Tech.
questions.explanation:
True.

	This was also shown in the "Fast Forward" season. April, Casey and Donatello were partners in the technology company. She and Donatello did the inventing for the company. The "Fast Forward" season is set in 2105 where the Turtles met up with Cody Jones, her great grandson.

questions.text: What nickname was April given by the Turtles in the 2003 animated series?
questions.explanation:
Jungle Girl.

	She was referred to as "Jungle Girl" in the in the season 2 episode called "April's Artifact". In that episode, she and the turtles were transported to another dimension that was jungle-like. While there, her survival instincts kicked in and she was given the nickname.

questions.text: In the 2003 animated series, April had earned a degree from New York University in what field?
questions.explanation:
Mathematics.

	April's college education focused on mathematics. First revealed in a book, and later in the series, her bachelor's degree was in general mathematics. She was shown to have an aptitude for all kinds of science and math throughout the series.
